details.title: Linear and adaptive spaceborne threedimensional SAR tomography: a comparison on real data

details.abstract: Three-dimensional (3-D) synthetic aperture radar (SAR) imaging is a recent technique, based on coherent SAR data combination, and aims to obtain a full 3-D analysis in space. It is a multibaseline extension of the SAR interferometry concept and offers new options for the analysis and monitoring of ground scenes by means of the capability of separating the scattering phenomena along the height dimension. In this work, the authors summarise and extend the results obtained by processing real ERS satellite urban data characterised by a long time span of acquisition and non-uniformly spaced satellite passes, comparing the performance in height focusing obtained with a singular value decomposition (SVD)-based method and adaptive beamforming.

ieee.title: Superresolution Differential Tomography: Experiments on Identification of Multiple Scatterers in Spaceborne SAR Data
ieee.displayText: Fabrizio Lombardini, Matteo Pardini, "Superresolution Differential Tomography: Experiments on Identification of Multiple Scatterers in Spaceborne SAR Data", Geoscience and Remote Sensing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 50, pp. 1117-1129, 2012, ISSN 0196-2892.

ieee.title: Spaceborne tomographic SAR techniques for analyzing garbled urban scenarios: Array processing advances and experiments
ieee.displayText: Fabrizio Lombardini, Francesco Cai, "Spaceborne tomographic SAR techniques for analyzing garbled urban scenarios: Array processing advances and experiments", Urban Remote Sensing Event (JURSE) 2011 Joint, pp. 197-200, 2011.

ieee.title: Tomographic Processing of Interferometric SAR Data: Developments, applications, and future research perspectives
